segment.source: How to Configure the Application Virtualization Management Servers
segment.target: How to Configure the Application Virtualization Management Servers

segment.source: How to Configure the Application Virtualization Management Servers
segment.target: How to Configure the Application Virtualization Management Servers

segment.source: How to Configure the Application Virtualization Management Servers
segment.target: How to Configure the Application Virtualization Management Servers

segment.source: Before virtualized applications can be streamed to the Application Virtualization Desktop Client or the Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services), the Application Virtualization Management Server must be configured.
segment.target: Before virtualized applications can be streamed to the Application Virtualization Desktop Client or the Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services), the Application Virtualization Management Server must be configured.

segment.source: When you configure the server, you are setting up the content directory where the SFT files are loaded and stored.
segment.target: When you configure the server, you are setting up the content directory where the SFT files are loaded and stored.

segment.source: The SFT files contain the virtualized application (or applications).
segment.target: The SFT files contain the virtualized application (or applications).

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Application Virtualization Servers stream SFT files to the Desktop Client and the Client for Remote Desktop Services using only RTSP or RTSPS protocols.
segment.target: Application Virtualization Servers stream SFT files to the Desktop Client and the Client for Remote Desktop Services using only RTSP or RTSPS protocols.

segment.source: The ICO (icon) file and the OSD (open software descriptor) file can be configured to stream from a different file or HTTP server.
segment.target: The ICO (icon) file and the OSD (open software descriptor) file can be configured to stream from a different file or HTTP server.

segment.source: To configure the Application Virtualization Management Server
segment.target: To configure the Application Virtualization Management Server

segment.source: Complete the following procedure:
segment.target: Complete the following procedure:

segment.source: How to Install Application Virtualization Management Server
segment.target: How to Install Application Virtualization Management Server

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: During the installation procedure, you specify the location of the Content directory on the Content Path screen.
segment.target: During the installation procedure, you specify the location of the Content directory on the Content Path screen.

segment.source: Navigate to the location that you specified for the Content directory, and if necessary, create the directory.
segment.target: Navigate to the location that you specified for the Content directory, and if necessary, create the directory.

segment.source: When the content directory is created, configure this directory as a standard file share.
segment.target: When the content directory is created, configure this directory as a standard file share.
